text: They were assigned cities of refuge: Shechem in the mountain region of Ephraim, with its pasture lands, Gezer with its pasture lands,
The defenders countered by setting up siege engines of their own, and kept up the fight a long time.
They set no king over the land, nor do they give rain.
They had not understood the incident of the loaves. On the contrary, their hearts were hardened.
The Jews quarreled among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us [his] flesh to eat?”
